meanings.definition: Counting more than the actual number of items.
meanings.sent1: The overcounting mistake led to incorrect results.
meanings.sent2: She realized her overcounting error when the numbers didn't add up.
meanings.sent3: The overcounting incident made everyone laugh at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His overcounting tendencies painted a misleading picture of the inventory.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned against overcounting to avoid errors in calculations.

meanings.sent1: Overcounting can lead to confusion in data analysis.
meanings.sent2: The overcounting of votes delayed the election results.
meanings.sent3: His overcounting of steps on the pedometer made him think he ran a marathon.
meanings.sent4: In the game of hide-and-seek, her overcounting made finding her too easy.
meanings.sent5: The overcounting of sheep did not help him fall asleep faster.
